definition: to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: The rebel lawmakers denounced his proposal as reckless.
sentences.chinese: 內訌的議員斥責他的提案不顧後果。

sentences.english: These verbs mean to reprimand or criticize angrily or vehemently .
sentences.chinese: 這些動詞意爲憤怒或惡毒地斥責或批評。

sentences.english: I can see you had eggs for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 老師斥責來前洗臉，“我能看你早飯喫的雞蛋”。

sentences.english: With a quick look the teacher reproved the child for whispering in class.
sentences.chinese: 老師以極快的表情斥責在課堂上交頭接耳的同學。

sentences.english: Earlier that day, inthe hospital, she had reprimanded him about a mistake he'd made, and now he wasdesperate to find out how he could redeem himself.
sentences.chinese: 當天早些時候，他由於犯錯，被她嚴厲地斥責了一番。

sentences.english: Are you willing to fuel such useless reprimands to fight against?
sentences.chinese: 你願意燃料等無用斥責打擊？

sentences.english: When I asked what was upsetting her so, she snapped at me.
sentences.chinese: 我問她是什麼使她如此煩惱，她則厲聲斥責我。

sentences.english: Appreciate the person who chided you, for furthering your wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 感激斥責你的人，因爲他助長了你的智慧。

sentences.english: She is always scolding her children.
sentences.chinese: 她老是斥責自己的子女。

sentences.english: He lowed words of reproof at his son.
sentences.chinese: 他低沈地用斥責的話來罵兒子。

sentences.english: He told off the employee severely.
His article was spanked by the public.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章受到了大衆的嚴厲斥責。

sentences.english: She threw the lie in his face.
For the next half-hour Jobs berated the group.
sentences.chinese: 在接下來的半個小時喬布斯嚴厲斥責了這個小組。

sentences.english: I never scolded,even if my children made mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我從不喜歡斥責，即使我的孩子犯了錯誤我也不發火。

sentences.english: He was slapped for his shouting.
sentences.chinese: 他因大喊大叫而受到斥責。

to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
